intro: Cochlearia crassifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved cochlearia, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves that are adapted to retain moisture in harsh environments. Its flowers are typically small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and bloom in early summer. Cochlearia crassifolia is often found growing on rocky slopes and in sandy soils, where it thrives in full sun.
